notesStmt.note: Refa᾿el ben Daniyel, Shemu᾿el ben Daniyel, Yitsḥaḳ ben Daniyel: inscribed in the colophon, folio .Censored by Dominico Irosolomitano, Italian censor (active in the last quarter of the 16th and first quarter of the 17th century): inscribed with his name, 1597 (folio 274v); see 61, and appendix § 62-74. Censored by Giovanni Domenico Carretto, Italian censor (active in the first quarter of the 17th century): inscribed with his name, 'Revisto per me Gio. Domenico Caretto 1609' (folio 273r); see 100-101, and appendix § 80-84. Luigi da Bologna, a converted Jew working for the Inquisition as censor (active at the end of the sixteenth, beginning of seventeenth century): inscribed with his name, 'Revisto per mi Fra Luigi da Bologna, 1597' (folio 274v), see 104, and appendix § 112-117. Folio 1r: several ownership notes: inheritants of Shelomoh of Cologne (Cremona), below this: Azri᾿el of Cologne, and afterwards: sons of Cologne.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.
